    • Constructor Detail

      • GuestModel

        public GuestModel(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String ip,
                  int port)
        The GuestModel function is the constructor for the GuestModel class. It initializes all the variables that are used in this class, and it also starts a new thread to connect to server in order for the game to start.
        Parameters:
        name - Set the name of the player
        ip - Set the ip address of the server
        port - Connect to the server at this given port

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        The getMessage function returns the message that is changing from time to time. This message will be shown to the user during the game.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface GameModel
        Returns:
        The message that needs to be shown on screen.

      • setUserQueryInput

        public void setUserQueryInput(java.lang.String word,
                              java.lang.String row,
                              java.lang.String col,
                              java.lang.String vertical)
        The setUserQueryInput function is used to set the user's input for a word, row, column and vertical/horizontal. It sends the players (user) word to the game server for validation according to the games rules. If the user chose to pass its turn (xxx) it sets the message on screen to be "turn over".
        Specified by:
        setUserQueryInput in interface GameModel
        Parameters:
        word - Store the word that is inputted by the user
        row - Set the row of the word to be placed on the board
        col - Set the column of the word to be placed on the board
        vertical - Indicate whether the word is horizontal or vertical

      • setUserChallengeInput

        public void setUserChallengeInput(java.lang.String request)
        The setUserChallengeInput function is used to set the user's challenge input. It sends the input to the game server. If the user chose not to challenge it sets the message on screen to be "turn over".
        Specified by:
        setUserChallengeInput in interface GameModel
        Parameters:
        request - Get the user's input for the offer of challenge (a specific move in the game)

      • getBoard

        public java.lang.String[][] getBoard()
        The getBoard function returns the board.
        Specified by:
        getBoard in interface GameModel
        Returns:
        The board array (matrix)

      • getMySocket

        public java.net.Socket getMySocket()
        The getMySocket function returns the socket the guest player opened for communication with the games host.

        The socket of the guest player

      • addScore

        public void addScore(int num)
        The addScore function adds the given number to the score of the guest player.
        Parameters:

        The addObserver function adds an observer to the list of observers.

      • addTiles

        public void addTiles(java.lang.String addedTiles)
        The addTiles function is called when the server sends a message that contains tiles for the guest player. The function adds these tiles to the player's strTiles arraylist, and notifies observers of this change.
        Parameters:
        addedTiles - is a string containing the received tiles from the server

      • challengeTrue

        public void challengeTrue(java.lang.String[] fromHost)
        The challengeTrue function is called when the client receives a message from the server that indicates that a challenge was successful. The function updates the board and score accordingly, and sets an appropriate message to be displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        fromHost - containing the information from the server
